decision_conditions: The proposed two storey front/side extension would, by reason of its bulk, scale, mass and roof form, appear as a visually intrusive feature in the street scene and would be harmful to the character and appearance of the surrounding area, contrary to Policy 7 of the Local Plan.

The proposed two storey front/side extension would by reason of its bulk, scale, mass and projection beyond the neighbouring property no. 15 Abbey Wood Lane, appear as an unacceptably dominant and an intrusive unneighbourly development when viewed from this neighbouring property, that would have an adverse impact on these neighbouring occupants due to overbearing impact, loss of outlook and increased sense of enclosure contrary to Policy 7 of the Local Plan and the Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent via email on 17/03/2023.

Notwithstanding the details shown on the submitted plans, this application solely relates to the proposed two storey front/side extension with porch to front and additions of two front and one rear dormer.
description: Enlargement of existing chalet bungalow involving two storey front/side extension with porch to front, additions of two front and one rear dormer and demolition of existing loft
